content: this legal text summarizes the progress of a case involving a dispute over the ownership and sale of eighteen purebred english bulldog dogs and a twobedroom apartment the case was heard in the county court varaždin 2nd instance after the initial hearing took place in the municipal court ivanec 1st instance the procedure cost 4037423 hrk 530539 eur and lasted approximately 34 years the final resolution ordered the dissolution of the coownership property through a public auction the defendant was ordered to pay the plaintiff an additional amount of hrk 22542000 as well as hrk 5458000 totaling hrk 28000000 with statutory interest the defendant was also ordered to pay the cost of the proceedings totaling hrk 4037423 the remaining part of the claim was rejected the principles of law used in the decision were article 50 paragraph 4 of the property act the coownership community will be dissolved and the purchase price will be divided equally between the parties the defendant is also obliged to pay the plaintiff for a twobedroom apartment the plaintiff is obliged to pay the defendant an amount of hrk 5993 the appeals made by both parties were addressed and the court found that the firstinstance court correctly determined the ownership of the dogs and the apartment the court partially granted the plaintiffs claim for payment for the sale of the apartment the appeals were mostly unfounded and the court upheld the judgment
